programmes.show_description: ...Williams: A Centenary Celebration (Omnibus). 100 years since his birth, Radio 4 Extra celebrates the legendary Kenneth Williams.
1/6. 4 Extra Debut. When tragedy strikes horse racing, jockey Rob Finn uncovers a world of fear, rumour and bad intentions. Stars Michael Kitchen.
6/6. Rockingham is dead. As the French pirate awaits execution, Dona risks everything for the man she loves. Stars Lorna Heilbron.
2/6. Fulton Jones resumes his old ways in the family home after his mystery absence of 20 years. Stars Robin Bailey. From June 1980.
9/20. A movie and an illicit cheese supper sparks Mainwaring's own Waterloo. Adapted from BBC TV. With Arthur Lowe. From 1975.
1/4. 4 Extra Debut. Edinburgh widower Leo is surprised to meet a woman from his past - all he expected was a haircut. Stars Mark Bonnar. From 2021.
1/10. 4 Extra Debut. Betty leaves her husband during the Great Depression to return to her warm and noisy family in Seattle. Read by Debora Weston.
1/5. Vera nabs a package to Ibiza, and Irene aims to save her friend from seduction. Starring Prunella Scales and Patricia Routledge.
3/6. In a first for the show, the audience manage to get on the scoreboard.
1/5. 4 Extra Debut. Were ravens sinful or saintly creatures? Joanna Pinnock finds out more from the world of ancient tales and history. From 1999.
A space for spiritual reflection with a Bible reading, prayer and a range of Christian music led by David Waters.

programmes.show_name: And The Academy Award Goes To ...
programmes.show_description: 1/4. Paul Gambaccini explores how The Godfather, and it's successful sequel won Best Picture Oscars. With James Caan. From 2009.
4 Extra Debut. Bernard Cribbins profiles Mollie Millest, who wrote many radio scripts for Kenneth Horne and later Beyond Our Ken. From 2008.

Roy Plomley challenges Eleanor Summerfield, Gillian Reynolds, David Nixon and Tim Rice to spot the mistakes. From August 1978.
4/6. Going for a drive through a time anomaly, Robin, Lesley and Dirk end up in Texas. Stars Hugh Bonneville. From July 2001.
An imagining of the impact of an over-bearing, bed-ridden mother on artist LS Lowry. Stars Lynda Baron and Reece Dinsdale.
4 Extra Debut. A holiday in the sun isn't the relaxing break one couple were expecting. Read by Chris Reilly.
